paragraphs.text: 'What happens on tour stays on tour': how a week on a young Tory campaign bus might look.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: news emerges that the Conservative party chairman, Grant Shapps, has jokingly promised young volunteers that the most active among them might get to go on holiday to Ibiza with Samantha and David Cameron
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: we imagine what a week on the road with the Road Trip 2015 team might look like
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "What happens on tour stays on tour," says one young volunteer, handing out the free, blue-coloured contraceptives as the group pass Milton Keynes
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "but don't let the guys at the back of the coach near these."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At the back are the socially conservative gang
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: One has taken his"It's not Adam & Steve" commemorative pin badge off and is using it to pierce the condoms
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The rest of the coach has just finished playing"identify the Ayn Rand quote"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: near the front of the bus the libertarians are swapping pill bottles
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "This is bat country," one of them mutters
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: another reads a book on the gold standard
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: After a day's leafleting in North Warwickshire, the team heads to the nearest Holiday Inn where a curry is being prepared
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It has taken two days for "Banter Bus" to emerge as the name of the team vehicle
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: edging out Winning Wagon and Chat Coach
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "How to spot a Labour voter" is the topic of conversation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is generally agreed that they are the ones who fly-tip in their own front gardens
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Within minutes of the party chairman telling the audience that the most successful campaigners may get to throw shapes with Sam Cam in Ibiza, groups have split off into the corners of the room to form campaign teams
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A mixture of Sophie Ellis-Bextor and Taylor Swift is encouraging young attendees to adjust their pocket squares and hit the dance floor
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The team encounter a group of Labour supporters who - as Central Office training suggested- broke into tears and fled when shown the standard-issue photograph of Ed Miliband standing in a puddle
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Volunteers carry the auto- tuned Nick Clegg apology for similar purposes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: headquarters has yet to devise a Ukip strategy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Later in the afternoon there is a brief tangle with the media as two young men brawl over the correct pronunciation of "Boadicea"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Local press are quick to the scene, and get shots of the men before they've been encouraged to remove their rosettes and tie pins
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Insiders whisper that it's really an argument about whose dance card was marked last night
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Oxbridge people get it," says one young man as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he leans over the table of a group of women enjoying their fourth curry dinner of the trip
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This is the first floor restaurant of a Hilton Doubletree, with all the ambience of a young offenders' institution
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The women have taken to dining in a protective circle with their handbags on the backs of their chairs, reminiscent of the Roman Legion's "testudo" or "tortoise" formation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A second man leans in to say,"Really, most people will agree that it's actually 'Doxbridge'."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Later that night there are unconfirmed reports that the man who invented the "Doxbridge" portmanteau to include his alma mater of Durham has been shivved with a plastic Liam Fox doll and has left the trip
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "We're all in this together," one volunteer cheerfully tells the receptionist as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Banter Bus makes an unexpected stop at a sexual health clinic
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The volunteers pile off and spend the morning getting tested, only for a red-faced doctor to explain that their symptoms (flatulence, lethargy) are the result of too much curry, and that since only two of them have been sexually active in the past month, this has been a complete waste of NHS time and money
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "We love the NHS," a group leader protests
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the others try very hard to look like they're one of the two
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For the rest of the day everything is described as "sound"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: after six hours of delivering leaflets in the rain, the team opt for KFC and vodka shots
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The team are cold
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Not only was the heating broken in the village hall they slept in last night, but the windows of the bus have all had to be kept open
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The driver has pointed to a European directive safeguarding his working conditions
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which has forced the team to crack the sunroof
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: By lunchtime, the cold and the EU directive has unified two groups who previously had not shared three words with each other
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the socially conservative volunteers and the libertarians demand the coach be stopped outside a Ukip field headquarters for them to defect
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: As one of the libertarians mutters "sound" at the sight of the Ukip flag, a Team 2015 staffer screams," You can't say that, that's our word", and has a cry
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In a recount of the votes minus the defectors, the vehicle has reverted to Chat Coach
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the group are arguing whether David Davis or Theresa May would survive longest on a desert island
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: before
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: someone lets slip that they know how to buy Twitter followers
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Within a few minutes the group are all upping their social media presence
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: That evening the Chat Coach stops for the final time
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the revellers enjoy an Ibiza-themed beer and curry night followed by Ibiza-themed laser quest
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One volunteer overhears Samantha Cameron's assistant screaming at Shapps over the phone, stating in no uncertain terms that Samantha would rather be trapped in a steam room with the two Eds than go on holiday with Team 2015, and that he could stick his competition
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The volunteer tweets excitedly to his 30,000 followers
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: only to remember that none of them are real
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: What happens on tour really does stay on tour
paragraphs.label: assumption
